title: Chess Boards Provided by The Department of Leveling Up, Housing and Communities

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Has Sheffield City Council submitted a bid for funding to the The Department of Leveling Up, Housing and Communities regarding the Leveling Up Parks Fund for the installation of a public chess table and seating?
If it has, has it been successful? And if it has been successful where will the chess table be situated within the city and what is the expected timetable for getting the table fitted?
Yours faithfully,
Robert Reiss

Dear Robert Reiss,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Chess board which
we received on 02/12/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 04/01/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Robert Reiss,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Chess board which
we received on 02/12/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Sheffield City Council was invited to submit a brief Expression of
Interest (EOI) to the Department for Levelling Up, Housing & Communities'
(DLUHC) Levelling Up Parks Fund specifically for the purchase and
installation a chess table and accompanying seats or benches for 4 people
in a local park and/or green space. The funding was confirmed by the
DLUHC in October 2023.
As yet no site has been identified for the installation of the chess table
and seat. Enquiries have been made with potential suppliers and installers
of chess table/chairs which would be suitable for a park/green space
setting.
Initial feasibility has focussed on considering sites which can both
accommodate and sustain such an installation and help achieve the outcomes
of the funding, which are; increase the visibility and public presence of
chess, strengthen community relationships, build local social cohesion,
and address loneliness by providing opportunities for people to come
together in a joint activity.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.

the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
